content.description: For a certain brand of canned corn, the company claims that the mean weight of the contents of the cans is 15.25 ounces. A random sample of 36 cans were selected. The sample was found to have mean 15.18 ounces and standard deviation 0.12 ounce. A hypothesis test will be conducted to investigate whether there is evidence to support the belief that the mean is less than 15.25 ounces.
content.question: Which of the following is the correct test statistic for the hypothesis test?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 15.18 minus 15.25, and denominator the fraction with numerator 0.12, and denominator 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.18</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15.25</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 15.18 minus 15.25, and denominator the fraction with numerator 0.12, and denominator 36" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.18</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15.25</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 15.25 minus 15.18, and denominator the fraction with numerator 0.12, and denominator 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15.18</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 15.25 minus 15.18, and denominator the fraction with numerator 0.12, and denominator 36" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15.18</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 15.25 minus 15.18, and denominator 0.12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15.18</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.12</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 15.18 minus 15.25, and denominator the fraction with numerator 0.12, and denominator 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.18</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15.25</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.5: Carrying Out a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
